availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Breckinridge County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah E. Dehaven. Father of Elizabeth J. Dehaven, Virginia Dehaven, Mary E. Dehaven, Henry C. Dehaven, and John N. Dehaven. Farmer in Breckinridge County in 1850 and 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in 1850.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District No. 2, p. 50A. Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District No. 2, p. 700B. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, District No. 2, p. 32. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breckinridge County, Wheatleys Precinct, p. 7.
